verses.verse: And as Jesus passed<WG3855> by, he saw<WG1492> a man<WG444> which was blind<WG5185> from his birth.<WG1079>
And his disciples<WG3101> asked<WG2065> him, saying,<WG3004> Master,<WG4461> who<WG5101> did sin,<WG264> this<WG3778> man, or<WG2228> his parents,<WG1118> that he was born<WG1080> blind?<WG5185>
Jesus<WG2424> answered,<WG611> Neither<WG3777> has this<WG3778> man sinned,<WG264> nor<WG3777> his parents:<WG1118> but that the works<WG2041> of God<WG2316> should be made manifest<WG5319> in him.

I must<WG1163> work<WG2038> the works<WG2041> of him that sent<WG3992> me, while<WG2193> it is day:<WG2250> the night<WG3571> comes,<WG2064> when<WG3753> no<WG3762> man<WG3762> can<WG1410> work. <WG2038>
As long<WG3752> as I am<WG1510> in the world,<WG2889> I am<WG1510> the light<WG5457> of the world. <WG2889>

When he had thus<WG5023> spoken,<WG2036> he spat<WG4429> on<WG5476> the ground,<WG5476> and made<WG4160> clay<WG4081> of the spittle,<WG4427> and he anointed<WG2025> <WG1909> the eyes<WG3788> of the blind<WG5185> man with the clay,<WG4081>

And said<WG2036> to him, Go,<WG5217> wash<WG3538> in the pool<WG2861> of Siloam, <WG4611> (which<WG3739> is by interpretation,<WG2059> Sent.<WG649>) He went<WG565> his way therefore,<WG3767> and washed,<WG3538> and came<WG2064> seeing.<WG991>
The neighbors<WG1069> therefore,<WG3767> and they which before<WG4386> had seen<WG2334> him that he was blind,<WG5185> said,<WG3004> Is not this<WG3778> he that sat<WG2521> and begged?<WG4319>
Some<WG243> said,<WG3004> This<WG3778> is he: others<WG243> said, He is like<WG3664> him: but he said,<WG3004> I am<WG1510> he.
Therefore<WG3767> said<WG3004> they to him, How<WG4459> were your<WG4675> eyes<WG3788> opened?<WG455>

He answered<WG611> and said,<WG2036> A man<WG444> that is called<WG3004> Jesus<WG2424> made<WG4160> clay,<WG4081> and anointed<WG2025> my<WG3450> eyes,<WG3788> and said<WG2036> to me, Go<WG5217> to the pool<WG2861> of Siloam,<WG4611> and wash:<WG3538> and I went<WG565> and washed,<WG3538> and I received<WG308> sight.<WG308>
Then<WG3767> said<WG2036> they to him, Where<WG4226> is he? He said,<WG3004> I know<WG1492> not.
They brought<WG71> to the Pharisees<WG5330> him that aforetime<WG4218> was blind.<WG5185>
And it was the sabbath<WG4521> day when<WG3753> Jesus<WG2424> made<WG4160> the clay,<WG4081> and opened<WG455> his eyes.<WG3788>

Then<WG3767> again<WG3825> the Pharisees<WG5330> also<WG2532> asked<WG2065> him how<WG4459> he had received<WG308> his sight.<WG308> He said<WG2036> to them, He put<WG2007> clay<WG4081> on my<WG3450> eyes,<WG3788> and I washed,<WG3538> and do see.<WG991>

Therefore<WG3767> said<WG3004> some<WG5100> of the Pharisees,<WG5330> This<WG3778> man<WG444> is not of God,<WG2316> because<WG3754> he keeps<WG5083> not the sabbath<WG4521> day. Others<WG243> said,<WG3004> How<WG4459> can<WG1410> a man<WG444> that is a sinner<WG268> do<WG4160> such<WG5108> miracles?<WG4592> And there was a division<WG4978> among<WG1722> them.
They say<WG3004> to the blind<WG5185> man again,<WG3825> What<WG5101> say<WG3004> you of him, that he has opened<WG455> your<WG4675> eyes?<WG3788> He said,<WG2036> He is a prophet.<WG4396>

But the Jews<WG2453> did not believe<WG4100> concerning<WG4012> him, that he had been<WG2258> blind,<WG5185> and received<WG308> his sight,<WG308> until<WG2193> they called<WG5455> the parents<WG1118> of him that had received<WG308> his sight.<WG308>

And they asked<WG2065> them, saying,<WG3004> Is this<WG3778> your<WG5216> son,<WG5207> who<WG3739> you say<WG3004> was born<WG1080> blind?<WG5185> how<WG4459> then<WG3767> does he now<WG737> see?<WG991>
His parents<WG1118> answered<WG611> them and said,<WG2036> We know<WG1492> that this<WG3778> is our son,<WG5207> and that he was born<WG1080> blind:<WG5185>

But by what<WG4459> means<WG4459> he now<WG3568> sees,<WG991> we know<WG1492> not; or<WG2228> who<WG5101> has opened<WG455> his eyes,<WG3788> we know<WG1492> not: he is of age;<WG2244> ask<WG2065> him: he shall speak<WG2980> for himself.<WG848>

These<WG5023> words spoke<WG2036> his parents,<WG1118> because<WG3754> they feared<WG5399> the Jews:<WG2453> for the Jews<WG2453> had agreed<WG4934> already,<WG2235> that if<WG1437> any<WG5100> man did confess<WG3670> that he was Christ,<WG5547> he should be put out of the synagogue.<WG656>
Therefore<WG1223> <WG5124> said<WG2036> his parents,<WG1118> He is of age;<WG2244> ask<WG2065> him.

Then<WG3767> again<WG1537> <WG1208> called<WG5455> they the man<WG444> that was blind,<WG5185> and said<WG2036> to him, Give<WG1325> God<WG2316> the praise:<WG1391> we know<WG1492> that this<WG3778> man<WG444> is a sinner.<WG268>
He answered<WG611> and said,<WG2036> Whether<WG1487> he be a sinner<WG268> or no, I know<WG1492> not: one<WG1520> thing I know,<WG1492> that, whereas I was blind,<WG5185> now<WG737> I see.<WG991>
Then<WG1161> said<WG2036> they to him again,<WG3825> What<WG5101> did<WG4160> he to you? how<WG4459> opened<WG455> he your<WG4675> eyes?<WG3788>

He answered<WG611> them, I have told<WG2036> you already,<WG2235> and you did not hear:<WG191> why<WG5101> would<WG2309> you hear<WG191> it again?<WG3825> will<WG2309> you also<WG2532> be his disciples?<WG3101>
Then<WG3767> they reviled<WG3058> him, and said,<WG2036> You are<WG1488> his disciple;<WG3101> but we are Moses'<WG3475> disciples.<WG3101>
We know<WG1492> that God<WG2316> spoke<WG2980> to Moses:<WG3475> as for this<WG5126> fellow, we know<WG1492> not from where<WG4159> he is.

The man<WG444> answered<WG611> and said<WG2036> to them, Why<WG1063> herein<WG1722> <WG5129> is a marvelous<WG2298> thing, that you know<WG1492> not from where<WG4159> he is, and yet he has opened<WG455> my<WG3450> eyes.<WG3788>

Now<WG1161> we know<WG1492> that God<WG2316> hears<WG191> not sinners:<WG268> but if<WG1437> any<WG5100> man be a worshipper<WG2318> of God,<WG2318> and does<WG4160> his will,<WG2307> him he hears.<WG191>
Since<WG1537> the world<WG165> began was it not heard<WG191> that any<WG5100> man opened<WG455> the eyes<WG3788> of one that was born<WG1080> blind.<WG5185>
If<WG1487> this<WG3778> man were not of God,<WG2316> he could<WG1410> do<WG4160> nothing.<WG3762>
They answered<WG611> and said<WG2036> to him, You were altogether<WG3650> born<WG1080> in sins,<WG266> and do you teach<WG1321> us? And they cast<WG1544> him out.
Jesus<WG2424> heard<WG191> that they had cast<WG1544> him out; and when he had found<WG2147> him, he said<WG2036> to him, Do you believe<WG4100> on<WG1519> the Son<WG5207> of God? <WG2316>
He answered<WG611> and said,<WG2036> Who<WG5101> is he, Lord,<WG2962> that I might believe<WG4100> on<WG1519> him?
And Jesus<WG2424> said<WG2036> to him, You have both<WG2532> seen<WG3708> him, and it is he that talks<WG2980> with you.
And he said,<WG5346> Lord,<WG2962> I believe.<WG4100> And he worshipped<WG4352> him.

And Jesus<WG2424> said,<WG2036> For judgment<WG2917> I am come<WG2064> into<WG1519> this<WG5126> world,<WG2889> that they which see<WG991> not might see;<WG991> and that they which see<WG991> might be made<WG1096> blind. <WG5185>
And some of the Pharisees<WG5330> which<WG3588> were with him heard<WG191> these<WG5023> words, and said<WG2036> to him, Are we blind<WG5185> also?<WG2532>

Jesus<WG2424> said<WG2036> to them, If<WG1487> you were blind,<WG5185> you should have<WG2192> no<WG3756> sin:<WG266> but now<WG3568> you say,<WG3004> We see;<WG991> therefore<WG3767> your<WG5216> sin<WG266> remains. <WG3306>
